fact: Deer are part of the Cervidae family.
Male deer are called bucks, females are does.
Most deer species grow and shed their antlers yearly.
Deer have excellent hearing and a strong sense of smell.
White-tailed deer can run up to 30 mph.
Deer are herbivores and eat leaves, twigs, and fruits.
Fawns have white spots for camouflage.
Deer communicate using body language, sounds, and scent.
Deer are preyed upon by wolves, bears, and humans.
The lifespan of a wild deer is usually 10-15 years.
Reindeer are the only deer species where both males and females grow antlers.
Deer have a four chambered stomach for digesting plants.
Some deer species can swim well to escape predators.
